quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Signs and Flower
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, signs, asteraceae. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many astrological signs are there in the Chinese zodiac?
Which of these wild roses is native to China?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosa laevigata

questions.question: It is considered that Chinese astrology emerged around this time.
Chinese zodiac is not limited to just defining what animal you are. It also tells you this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Your element

questions.question: The common name of the flower, Lilium lancifolium, is the name of a character in which childrens classic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Adventures of Peter Pan

questions.question: What was the name of the Emperor who introduced the first cycle of Chinese zodiac in 2637 BC?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Huang Ti

questions.question: Gypsophila flowers are sometimes referred to as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babys breath

questions.question: Highly coveted bulbs of a member of the Liliaceae family, caused this in the Netherlands in the early 17th century.
Who determined the order in which the astrological signs appear?
Dianthus caryophyllus, or carnation,  was originally grown in which colour?
Which sign is considered to be most lucky and powerful?
How many groups are the twelve signs arranged in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 groups of 3

questions.question: How many solar segments are there in a year of the Chinese calendar?
To define someones personality, the Chinese consider this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The year of birth

questions.question: Asteraceae is a flower, commonly known as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the these

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Risotto and Rice
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, ladle, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There are more ladles of broth to be added to risotto until the rice reaches the al dente state. You should add each ladle of broth when this happens.

options.text: The rice absorbs the previous one

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The rice absorbs the previous one

questions.question: The roots of Chinese astrology lay in the teachings of this ancient Chinese philosopher.
To prevent rice from sticking, you should do this.
The moment to serve the risotto has come.  Let it stand for three minutes so that flavours mix, then prepare the plates. To serve risotto properly, you should do what with the plates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Preheat them

questions.question: The traditional Czech farmhouse hard cheese, made in Karlovy Vary, is known by what name?
What company is the manufacturer of Mr. Goodbar?
When you add the previously prepared seasoning, pour one third of a cup of this beverage and wait for it to evaporate.
The first industrial production of cheese in the world started in 1815,  in which country?
You can make your risotto even more delicious by stirring a quarter cup of heavy cream, which would turn your Risotto into this kind.
Once rice is soft enough, you should add this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A tablespoon of butter

questions.question: You should stir the rice while frying it until it becomes this.
This is the kind of rice you should use for your risotto.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Round or semi-round rice

questions.question: When you add a ladle of broth to the risotto, it should be in this condition.
You should begin the preparation of your meal by mincing a small onion and mixing it with herbs. Then you should saute them in olive oil or this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unsalted butter

questions.question: Which of the following cheeses is a hard cheese?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Cheese and Flower
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, liliaceae, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Juustoleipa cheese, traditionally made from reindeer milk, is typical of which region in Europe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finland and Lapland

questions.question: In 1666 the first legal document to mention cheese was issued in Toulouse and it referred to what sort of cheese?
The first TV commercial for cheese was aired in 1968 for which sort of French cheese?
Airag is a Turkish semi-soft cheese made from what milk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mare milk

questions.question: This perennial bulbous plant from the family of Liliaceae is the national flower of Iran.
What is the common name of the national flower of India, which is also called Sacred water lily and is often associated with Buddhism?
Mascarpone is a  vegetarian Italian cheese, traditionally included in the recipe for  what layered dessert?
This plant, whose name in Greek means rose tree, is widespread in the Sino-Himalayan region and is the national flower of Nepal.
In 1953, several European countries ratified this convention to protect some sorts of cheese from conterfeiting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Stresa Convention

questions.question: Which is the national flower of Mexico and Columbia, introduced to Europe as late as the end of the 19th century?
This special kind of clover, originally used in medicine, is the national flower of Ireland.
In 1536 cheese-makers in Veneto, Italy, created the oldest precedent of falsification by trying to make what cheese?
It is national flower of Venezuela, and its family consists of more than 25 000 species.
This famous mountain flower, endangered in many countries, is the national flower of Switzerland and Austria.
This flower, often associated with narcissism and egoism in art, is the national flower of Wales.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fashion and Designer
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bar, designer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This American fashion designer is widely recognized as the creator of the American Look.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Claire McCardell

questions.question: This plant with small blue flower heads, often regarded as a weed in the past, is the national flower of Estonia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue cornflower

questions.question: Where did popcorn originate?
The first hotdog stand in New York was opened in 1867.
Where was the first wrapped candy bar sold?
What year were the first frozen pizzas introduced in grocery stores?
The trilby is an item which belongs to what clothing group?
In 1987, this designer received an Oscar for Best Foreign Designer from the Council of Fashion Designers of America, and later the same year, he opened his own couture house in Paris.
In the 1920s, this fashion designer popularized the little black dress - a short  evening or cocktail dress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coco Chanel

questions.question: Which company created the worlds largest doughnut in 1998?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winchells House of Doughnuts

questions.question: Lionel Sterberger grilled the first cheeseburger in 1945.
George Crum invented potato chips.
What famous person made the following observation about fashion: Fashion wears out more apparel than the man?

This fashion designer, whose first collection was entitled The Trapeze Line, once said the following words: I wish I had invented blue jeans. They have expression, modesty, sex appeal, simplicity - all I hope for in my clothes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ives Saint-Laurent

questions.question: In what year did William Kolb invent the first red candy apple?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Beer
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, ewes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The French fries are believed to have been invented in what country?
What Greek cheese is made of 70% ewes and 30% goats milk?
What is the executive chef of the kitchen called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chef de Cuisine

questions.question: What do you call an Austrian dessert that is a sweet almond paste dipped in chocolate?
What are the ingredients of  the cold Spanish soup Gazpacho?

options.text: Beans, onions, tomatoes, spearmint and carrots
Stale bread, garlic, olive oil, salt, tomato and vinegar
Beef, onions, red peppers, and paprika powder
Puréed leeks, onions, potatoes, cream and chicken stock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stale bread, garlic, olive oil, salt, tomato and vinegar

questions.question: Risotto is made with special kinds of rice and is traditionally served with fish products or cheese. What country does this dish come from?
The term cenosillicaphobia, related to drinking beer and alcohol as a whole, means what?

options.text: A fear of a falling glass
A fear of an empty glass
A fear of a broken glass
A fear of breaking a glass

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A fear of an empty glass

questions.question: Name the traditional Russian hot soup made of broth, beets, and tomato juice with various vegetables.
John Wagner, the first American to produce lager beer, had a brewery in which state?
This is a traditional dish in Austria and Germany made of a thin peace of veal meat coated with flour, egg and bread crumb.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wiener Schnitzel

questions.question: The oldest known recipe for a beverage still in existence is a recipe for beer.
Where did the modern-day restaurant come from?
Fry up is another name for the traditional breakfast of what country?
One of the possible origins of the popular expression rule of thumb  is believed to be connected to the process of brewing beer.
What candy bar was used in the 1985 movie The Goonies?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Beer and Feng Shui
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, ears, bock. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The cycle FIRE - EARTH - METAL - WATER - WOOD - FIRE is known as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cycle of production

questions.question: According to Feng Shui water symbolizes one of these.
Where were the oldest ears of popcorn found in 1948?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bat Cave, New Mexico

questions.question: Charles Dickens made the following statement about beer: It was as natural as eating and to me as necessary, and I would not have thought of eating a meal without drinking beer.
When was popcorn first introduced in movie theaters?
One of the major purposes of Feng Shui is the search for the universal abstract energy or life force that governs our world. It is called this.
Wind is one of the five elements.
The national epic poem of which country includes an early ode to beer in Verse XX: Sing the songs of beer immortal!?
Is irregularly shaped land good to build your home on?

Native American folklore told of calm spirits who lived inside each kernel of popcorn, but they got angry if their homes were heated and finally burst out. In reality, what do these spirits represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Water and starch

questions.question: According to Feng Shui the toilet should be this.

options.text: It does not matter where the toiler is.

questions.question: Samuel Adams Triple Bock, produced by the Boston Beer Company, reaches what percentage of alcohol by volume?
During World War II, Americans increased their popcorn consumption three times, because this product was not as widely available as it had been prior to the war.
The master bedroom should be as far away from the front door as possible.
Literally translated Feng Shui means wind and water.
